decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The cumulative impact of the proposed roof alterations to enlarge the main roofs at both properties, including raising the roof ridge and altering the original pitch angle, together with the proposed flat roof element above the existing two-storey extension at No.52, by reason of excessive bulk, scale, massing and design would result in an unsympathetic, incongruous, top-heavy and visually intrusive form of development that fails to respect the scale, proportions and design of both host buildings, neighbouring properties and the wider streetscene. This would be to the detriment of the character and appearance of the subject buildings, the wider pattern of development and visual amenities of the area, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) policy D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021), policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and policy DM1 of the Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).
description: Alterations to roof including increase in ridge height and alterations to the pitch at both properties; rear dormer, single storey rear extension,  first floor rear infill extension and external alterations to No.52:  Alterations to roof, rear dormer, single storey front extension incorporating porch, first floor side extension and external alterations to No.54
